member.name: M:Jcd.Tasks.SimpleThreadedTaskScheduler.TryExecuteTaskInline(System.Threading.Tasks.Task,System.Boolean)
member.summary: The method to attempt executing a Task in the calling thread's context. This is disabled by default. See remarks for discussion.
member.param: the task to try inlining
indicates if it was previously queued with this scheduler

member.name: T:Jcd.Tasks.SynchronizedValue`1
member.summary: Provides a simple async-safe and thread-safe method of setting, getting, acting on, and altering values shared among tasks and threads.
member.typeparam: The data type to synchronize access to.

remarks.para: While this provides a method of easily ensuring any one shared value is appropriately locked during setting or getting, you still need to thoroughly understand your use case. For example, having two instances accessed by two different threads, in rapid succession, in different orders can cause potentially unexpected results.

In cases where the pair/tuple must be consistent at all times across all accesses, consider creating a struct containing the necessary fields/properties and wrapping that in a instead of each individual field/property.

As well this implementation uses and requires Dispose to be called. Either implement or call it directly at the appropriate time. See the documentation for , , , and for recursive reentrancy considerations. (i.e. don't try it!)
